description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2bbkv","text":"This protocol provides an overview of the Multimodal Molecular Imaging pipeline used by the Vanderbilt University Tissue Interrogation Site (VU TIS) as part of the Kidney Precision Medicine Project (KPMP). Individual protocols are contextualized within our larger workflow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: VU Biomolecular Multimodal Imaging Center / Spraggins Research Group

references.title: Autofluorescence microscopy as a label-free tool for renal histology and glomerular segmentation
references.authors: Patterson NH, Neumann EK, Sharman K, Allen J, Harris R, Fogo AB, De Caestecker M, Caprioli RM, Van de Plas R, Spraggins JM

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6hd0v","text":"Autofluorescence Microscopy (AF) is collected on all KPMP tissue sections prior to IMS. AF is also collected on an external reference tissue termed \"BlockQC\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":149,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r78h","text":"AF QC Data Collection Protocol: AFQC Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dhsl","text":"AF protocol: AF Microscopy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":13,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"9b8po","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1ejk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D2E18D80ABDE11ED9E8D7D1BF96C6BFB","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.e6nvwjm5dlmk/v1"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"156FDBA0C82911EDAC630DDB1C3EA4C6","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.5jyl8jozdg2w/v1"}},"2":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Patterson NH, Tuck M, Van de Plas R, Caprioli RM","can_edit":true,"date":1541462400,"doi":"https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.analchem.8b02884","guid":"9AB22E90CF0811ED9822A3A405759B6E","id":0,"journal":"","protocol_id":0,"title":"Advanced Registration and Analysis of MALDI Imaging Mass Spectrometry Measurements through Autofluorescence Microscopy."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63rkn","text":"MALDI Imaging Mass Spectrometry (IMS)  is collected on all KPMP tissue sections and on a BlockQC tissue section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"italic","offset":89,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7j1am","text":"Matrix Deposition Protocol (Sublimation): Tissue Washing and Matrix deposition Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":45}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kvo3","text":"High Spatial Resolution MALDI IMS Data Acquisition: MALDI IMS Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":52,"length":18}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9918A7E0ABDF11ED9E8D7D1BF96C6BFB","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.n92ldpyn9l5b/v1"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"787B2B03CF0711EDA9710A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.n92ldpq99l5b/v1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2s8i0","text":"Asses Kidney Tissue Sections","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bs27","text":"To accept biopsies for multimodal molecular imaging analysis by VU TIS, the samples must meet the following Go/No-Go conditions (Table 1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tnuh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce4vp","text":"Table 1. Sample Processing Go/No-Go Criteria ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32lm8","text":"     Sample Processing   Go/No-Go Criteria      Reasoning        Biopsy must be LN2 core      Other storage conditions can induce   analyte suppression effect in MALDI IMS analysis        Biopsy size must be Â³ 3mm      Smaller tissue sections are difficult to   handle, section, and mount        Time to preservation must be \u003c 10 min      Prolonged exposure prior to preservation   can cause metabolite/lipid degradation   ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":423}],"data":{}},{"key":"85qrq","text":"\nSectioning","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91r6l","text":"Accepted biopsies are sectioned and visually assessed following the QC metrics described in Table 2. Biopsies are cryo-sectioned to 10 Âµm thickness on indium-tin-oxide (ITO)-coated (for imaging mass spectrometry) or glass (for stained microscopy) slides. For workflow QC, a normal human kidney reference tissue section (termed BlockQC) is sectioned along with KPMP samples.  For cryo-sectioning,  samples are mounted to a chuck using a small amount of optimal cutting temperature (OCT) compound. Photos are taken before, during, and after sectioning (with and without mounting media) to document the process and ensure proper handling. After sections are obtained, the OCT is removed from the tissue block, and the samples are stored at -80oC. Tissue sections are visually assessed following the QC metrics described in Table 2 before data collection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":820,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp2tv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11jmu","text":"Table 2. On-Site Tissue Integrity Considerations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bss3p","text":"Tissue QCReasoning / Data FlagsAre there any glomeruli in the biopsy section?Ensures proper coverage of biological featuresVisible cracks/folds on the tissue surfaceThis can lower FTU segmentation performance, due to non-segmentable featuresVisible freezing artifacts on the tissue surfaceFreezing artifacts can induce analyte delocalization, jeopardizing MALDI IMS spatial integrity","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":383}],"data":{}},{"key":"f5aq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rcg3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["261","350"],"data":[["Go/No-Go Criteria","  \u003cb\u003eReasoning\u003c/b\u003e  "],["Biopsy must be LN2 core\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e  ","Other storage conditions can induce analyte suppression effect in MALDI IMS analysis  "],["Biopsy size must be \u003e 3mm  ","Smaller tissue sections are difficult to handle, section, and mount  "],["Time to preservation must be \u0026lt; 10 min","Prolonged exposure prior to preservation can cause metabolite/lipid degradation  "]],"guid":"FE178F02CF0411EDA9710A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8m884","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Go/No-Go Criteria","  \u003cb\u003eReasoning\u003c/b\u003e  "],["Biopsy must be LN2 core\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e  ","Other storage conditions can induce analyte suppression effect in MALDI IMS analysis  "],["Biopsy size must be \u003e 3mm  ","Smaller tissue sections are difficult to handle, section, and mount  "],["Time to preservation must be \u0026lt; 10 min","Prolonged exposure prior to preservation can cause metabolite/lipid degradation  "]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":""},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["253","358"],"data":[["\u003cb\u003eTissue QC\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003eReasoning / Data Flags\u003c/b\u003e"],["Are there any glomeruli in the biopsy section?\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e","Ensures proper coverage of biological features"],["Visible cracks/folds on the tissue surface","This can lower FTU segmentation performance, due to non-segmentable features"],["Visible freezing artifacts on the tissue surface","Freezing artifacts can induce analyte delocalization, jeopardizing MALDI IMS spatial integrity"]],"guid":"6452716CCF0511EDA9710A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1v972","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["\u003cb\u003eTissue QC\u003c/b\u003e","\u003cb\u003eReasoning / Data Flags\u003c/b\u003e"],["Are there any glomeruli in the biopsy section?\u003cb\u003e\u003c/b\u003e","Ensures proper coverage of biological features"],["Visible cracks/folds on the tissue surface","This can lower FTU segmentation performance, due to non-segmentable features"],["Visible freezing artifacts on the tissue surface","Freezing artifacts can induce analyte delocalization, jeopardizing MALDI IMS spatial integrity"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73o23","text":"QC data collected during this work will be compiled in Levy-Jennings plots to longitudinally track the performance of the assays. QC data for both the KPMP samples and the reference tissue are summarized and reported. QC/QA protocols for the multimodal molecular imaging pipeline are summarized in the protocol QC Metrics for KPMP Data Collection by VU TIS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":311,"length":45}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0BEFD450B46740989B32145019059889","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.14egn3wqyl5d/v1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ghp3","text":"KPMP Biopsy Shipment to VU TIS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cssr","text":"KPMP biopsies are shipped on dry ice to VU TIS. Temperature is monitored using MadgeTech data loggers. Specimens and relevant information are recorded in Redcap, and samples are store at -80oC until sectioning. Prior to sectioning, samples are assessed according to Table 1, described below.
